summary: React TypeScript data table app with Art Institute of Chicago API integration, featuring PrimeReact DataTable with server-side pagination and persistent row selection across pages
architectural_notes: Must use Vite (not CRA) with TypeScript (not JavaScript)
Use PrimeReact DataTable for table UI
Server-side pagination: fetch only current page data
Persistent selection: track row IDs/keys only, not full objects
Custom selection: calculate across pages mathematically without prefetching
CRITICAL: Never prefetch other pages or store their data in variables for selection
known_issues: Avoid async loops fetching multiple pages for custom selection (auto-rejection)
Do not store row objects from other pages in state
Custom selection must use ID-based strategy, not data fetching

existing_features.title: Install and configure PrimeReact library with DataTable component support
Create TypeScript interface for artwork data matching API response structure with fields: id, title, place_of_origin, artist_display, inscriptions, date_start, date_end
Fetch artwork data from Art Institute of Chicago API endpoint https://api.artic.edu/api/v1/artworks?page=1 on initial page load
Display artwork data in PrimeReact DataTable with columns for title, place_of_origin, artist_display, inscriptions, date_start, and date_end
Implement server-side pagination controls that fetch new data from API when user navigates between pages
Add checkboxes for row selection supporting individual row selection and select-all for current page only
Create custom row selection overlay panel with input field allowing user to select N number of rows through numeric input
Implement persistent row selection using ID-based tracking strategy that maintains selection state across page navigation without prefetching or storing data from other pages
Handle custom row selection input where N exceeds current page row count using an ID-based calculation strategy that does not fetch or store data from other pages
Apply a clean, professional design style with consistent colors, typography, and spacing suitable for a data-focused artwork gallery application
